document.discussion_title: Fraser touches down in Orange | Central Western Daily
document.topic_text: Turn Back Time: Dawn Fraser touches down in Orange 12 Aug 2016, 1:47 p.m. This week we explore the history of Orange from August 12, 1967 THIS week we explore the history of Orange from The Central Western daily dated Saturday August 12, 1967. So once again, let’s turn back time… Dawn Fraser in Orange on yesterday afternoon’s plane and spent the first 40 minutes of her arrival coping with press, radio and TV interviews. Dawn received debutantes at the special Education Week Ball in Blayney last night. Dental health expert, Miss Florence Mildern, currently in Orange, tells us that beer has health giving properties, at least teeth wise. First class mail deliveries to and from Orange will not be affected by the 24 hour rail stoppage in NSW from midnight tomorrow. The first mail train out of Orange after the strike will be on Tuesday night. Now screening at the Coronet Theatre “King Rat” a World War II film directed by Bryan Forbes, and starring George Segal as Corporal King and James Fox as Marlowe. The film was adapted from James Clavell's novel King Rat (1962). MOVIE OF THE DAY: Screening at the Coronet Theatre was 'King Rat'. Latest News
